Paragraph: Data regarding respiratory pattern defects during interictal periods also are scarce .

| Disease |
| --- |
| Respiratory pattern defects |

Note: In the given paragraph, "respiratory pattern defects during interictal periods" is the disease entity mentioned. "Interictal periods" refers to the time between seizures or fits in a person with epilepsy.

Note: "Data" and "regarding" do not refer to chemical entities. "Defects during interictal periods" can be interpreted as changes in the respiratory pattern during interictal periods, which is a physiological process and not a chemical substance. Therefore, "respiratory pattern defects" is not a valid chemical entity.
